oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Delayed Breeding Optimizes Conception in Dairy Cows with Prolonged Estrus
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Villarroel, A.
Lane, V. M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: estrus
insemination
ovulation
conception risk
prolonged estrus
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A common question of dairy farmers is whether to breed a cow that is still in estrus several hours after insemination. It is possible these cows have a longer interval between onset of estrus and ovulation time, and thus AM-PM rule is not valid. The objective of this study was to compare conception risk in cows with prolonged estrus bred once vs. twice (12 hours apart).
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2010; 256
